sen.j: 1878年2月、得度して真宗大谷派の僧侶となり、東本願寺育英教校に入学、その留学生として東京大学予備門に進み、1887年に東京大学文学部哲学科を首席で卒業。
sen.e: In February 1878, he entered the Buddhist priesthood, became a Buddhist monk of Shinshu Otani sect (Shinshu Otani-ha), and entered Higashi Hongan-ji Ikuei School; and as the representative student from there, he entered the preparatory school of the University of Tokyo (Tokyo Yobimon) and graduated from the department of philosophy of the Faculty of Letters, University of Tokyo with highest honors.

In February 1878, he entered the Buddhist priesthood, becoming a monk of the Shinshu Otani sect (Shinshu Otani-ha), and after entering Higashi Hongan-ji's Ikuei School, he was chosen to go to the University of Tokyo's preparatory school (Tokyo Yobimon), graduating from the university's Department of Philosophy of the Faculty of Letters with highest honors in 1887.

sen.e: While leading such a life, he was, on the academic side, eager to read "Tannisho" (Lamentations of Divergences), etc., and while practicing self-discipline in life, he introduced his "being philosophical", which was the area of his specialty, and wrote "Shukyo Tetsugaku Gaikotsu" (The Skeleton of a Philosophy of Religion) and "Tarikimon Tetsugaku Gaikotsu" (The Skeleton of a Philosophy of Other Power's Gate).

sen.e: He is greatly credited with accepting the religious faith of Jodo Shinshu and introducing the faith to the modern world of thoughts on the educational basis of modern Western philosophy, and he greatly contributed to propelling modernization of Buddhism both domestically and internationally based on the educational and religious background.
